column1: Vladimr Remek (born 26 September 1948 in ?esk Bud?jovice, Czechoslovakia) is a Czech politican, diplomat and sales representative, and a former cosmonaut and military pilot.
He is the first Czechoslovak in space and the first cosmonaut from a country other than the Soviet Union or the United States.
He flew aboard Soyuz 28 from March 2 to March 10, 1978, for seven days, 22 hours, and 17 minutes.

column2: In 2004 he was elected into the European Parliament.

column1: Vladimr Remek was born in ?esk Bud?jovice to Czech mother and Slovak father.
In 1970 Vladimr Remek became military pilot.
In 1976 he finished a Gagarin Air Force Academy in Monino, Moscow Region.
Remek joined the Intercosmos program in 1976; his backup was Old?ich Pel?k.
He was elected again into the European Parliament in 2009 European Parliament election.
The asteroid 2552 Remek is named after him.
